title: Have researchers agreed yet on a justifiable reason for the Flynn Effect of a secular rise in IQ scores? - Quora

response.answer_text: No they don't. Some think this happen because of much more schooling and familiarity with tests, some think it is because of better nutrition, or a super stimulation due to social media, some involve the lack of infectious ilnesses and better growth.  I will underline only 2 interesting side effects.  A reverse Flynn effect was noted at highly intelligent individuals. The Flynn effect stopped already in the most technically advanced countries after 1990-2000, but it is still going on in countries still developing economically and technologically.
Well, I can't directly answer your question. However, I know a popular theory is greater access to good compared to back then.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by W. A. Lipke
